publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3497 Hugh O’Donnell: Fairbridge Works—That the Parliament congratulates the youth work charity, Fairbridge, on the vital work that it undertakes to ensure that every young person has a fair chance to succeed in life; notes the strong contribution that Fairbridge makes to the More Choices, More Chances strategy and the Curriculum for Excellence, by working with over 680 disengaged or excluded young people each year across Dundee, Edinburgh and Glasgow, many of whom face issues such as low self-esteem, poor social and life skills, mental health issues or drug and alcohol addictions; recognises that Fairbridge offers individuals a fresh start, someone to believe in them and a chance to develop the skills and confidence that they need to change their own lives, and considers that ongoing investment in early intervention and first-step services at a local level is essential to closing the opportunity gap among Scotland’s young people.

S3M-3497 Fairbridge Works (lodged on 23 February 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Kenneth Gibson*, Pauline McNeill*, Iain Smith*, Nanette Milne*, Liam McArthur*, Stuart McMillan*, Sandra White*, Rob Gibson*, Robert Brown*, Marlyn Glen*, Malcolm Chisholm*, Des McNulty*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Trish Godman*
S3M-3497 Fairbridge Works (lodged on 23 February 2009) Angela Constance*, Bob Doris*, Maureen Watt*, Robin Harper*, Jim Tolson*, Jamie Stone*, Mike Pringle*
S3M-3497 Fairbridge Works (lodged on 23 February 2009) Ken Macintosh*, Alison McInnes*, Jackie Baillie*

S3M-3497 Hugh O’Donnell: Fairbridge Works—That the Parliament congratulates the youth work charity, Fairbridge, on the vital work that it undertakes to ensure that every young person has a fair chance to succeed in life; notes the strong contribution that Fairbridge makes to the More Choices, More Chances strategy and the Curriculum for Excellence, by working with over 680 disengaged or excluded young people each year across Dundee, Edinburgh and Glasgow, many of whom face issues such as low self-esteem, poor social and life skills, mental health issues or drug and alcohol addictions; recognises that Fairbridge offers individuals a fresh start, someone to believe in them and a chance to develop the skills and confidence that they need to change their own lives, and considers that ongoing investment in early intervention and first-step services at a local level is essential to closing the opportunity gap among Scotland’s young people. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Kenneth Gibson, Pauline McNeill, Iain Smith, Nanette Milne, Liam McArthur, Stuart McMillan, Sandra White, Rob Gibson, Robert Brown, Marlyn Glen, Malcolm Chisholm, Des McNulty, Joe FitzPatrick, Trish Godman, Angela Constance, Bob Doris, Maureen Watt, Robin Harper, Jim Tolson, Jamie Stone, Mike Pringle, Ken Macintosh, Alison McInnes, Jackie Baillie, Jack McConnell*, Bill Kidd*
S3M-3497 Fairbridge Works (lodged on 23 February 2009) Gil Paterson*, Christine Grahame*
S3M-3497 Fairbridge Works (lodged on 23 February 2009) Karen Whitefield*
